description: If Identity Management feature is enabled, this trap will be generated when the memory usage level changes.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrMemLevelChange EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrTrapSeverity i 1 EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrMemUsageLevel i 1 EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrMemUsage i 9999 EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrMemMaxSize i 9999 EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrEffectiveStaleAgingTime i 9999

description: The Memory usage is within normal usage limits, <= 80% of configured maximum database size.
The memory usage level is high. Memory usage is more than 80% and less than or equal to 90% of configured maximum database size.
The memory usage level is at critical level. Memory usage is more than 90% of configured maximum database size.
The memory usage level reached to maximum. Memory usage almost at 98% or more of configured maximum database size.
variables.name: EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrMemUsageLevel

description: Configured identity management maximum database memory size (in KBytes).
variables.name: EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrMemMaxSize

description: The effective stale aging time because of memory usage level change (in seconds).
variables.name: EXTREME-IDMGR-MIB::extremeIdMgrEffectiveStaleAgingTime
